title: Ticket #2326: 127.0.0.2 preferred as "public' IP address; not identified as loopback
description:
The IPv6ified code path has new code for identifying loopback addresses. It erroneously only detected 127.0.0.1, reporting everything else as a potentially public IP address. If a machine has another loopback address, say, 127.0.0.2, it will be considered as a usable address. The daemons may end up selecting it for advertising over a real public IP address.

Guilty code is condor_sockaddr::is_loopback() in /src/condor_utils/condor_sockaddr.cpp line 116. Replacing with logic copied from is_loopback_net in /src/condor_utils/internet.cpp line 859. (Why copy? Because in the eventual fully IPv6 friendly world, is_loopback_net is doomed.)
check_ins: 2011-Jul-21 11:58   Check-in [22564]: condor_sockaddr now recognizes 127.*.*.* as loopback, not just 127.0.0.1. Buggy version never shiped; no version history entry. ===GT=== #2326 ===GT:Fixed=== #2326 ===VersionHistory=== None (By Alan De Smet )
